Log#

Here, the class log is shown and described.

class log#

Public Functions

inline log(const mml::string path)#

Constructor.

Parameters:

path – Path to the logfile

inline log()#

Empty constructor.

inline ~log() noexcept#

Deconstructor.

mml::log &operator=(std::string value) noexcept#

Open new log file;.

Parameters:

value – Path to the logfile

void backup(bool verbose = true, bool Reset = true) noexcept#

Backups the log file by copying it to [filename].bak.

Parameters:

  • verbose – Verbose output

  • Reset – reset the actual log file so that it is empty

void close() noexcept#

Close log file.

mml::string getline(size_t line) noexcept#

Return a specific line form the log file.

Parameters:

line – Line Number

Returns:

string

mml::string getline_back(size_t line)#

Get a specific line from the log file.

Parameters:

line – Line number from the last line

Throws:

runtime_error – : if line number exceeds lines

Returns:

string

mml::string lastline() noexcept#

Get the last line of a logfile.

Note

that if the last line is a new line, the result will be a new line

Returns:

string

void header() noexcept#

Create new header.

void open()#

Open a logfile.

Parameters:

path – Path to log file

Throws:

runtime_error – : if logpath is not set

void print(const bool linenumber = false) noexcept#

Print log file.

Parameters:

linenumber – Print the linenumber

void reset(const bool verbose = true) noexcept#

Reset logfile.

Parameters:

verbose – Verbose output what is performed

inline void set_num(const int num) noexcept#

Set number of backup files.

Parameters:

num – Number of backup files

inline void set_path(const mml::string path) noexcept#

Set path of the logfile.

Parameters:

path – New path of the logfile

Friends

template<typename T>
inline friend log &operator<<(mml::log &log, const T &String) noexcept#

Writes a value into the logfile.

Parameters:

  • log – Instance of the class to be used

  • String – Value to be written into the log file

inline friend log &operator<<(mml::log &log, std::ostream &(*manip)(std::ostream&)) noexcept#

Output special characters like std::endl.

Parameters:

manip – to be printed

Returns:

ostream
